question: Which of the following statements is correct?
choices: Sickle cell anaemia is a quantitative problem.
Female carrier for haemophilia may transmit the disease to sons.
Change in whole set of chromosomes is called aneuploidy.
explanation: Haemophilia is an X-linked recessive disorder. A carrier female (heterozygous) can transmit the disease to her sons. Sickle cell anaemia is qualitative (wrong amino acid), Thalassemia is quantitative (fewer globin chains), and a change in a whole set of chromosomes is Euploidy/Polyploidy.
